author: Special Correspondent
text:
TVS Motor hopes to increase its market share in the executive-class motorbike segment with its launch of TVS Victor, a motorbike with superior engine performance and competitive pricing.

Introducing the newer version of the motorbike, which was first launched in 2002, here on Wednesday, company’s vice-president J.S. Srinivasan said that the new motorbike came with a balance between performance, comfort and convenience.

The motorbike, he said, would give a mileage of 76 km per litre. The bike comes in six colours and two variants of drum brake and disc brakes. The bike has been priced at Rs. 53,800 and Rs. 55,800 for drum brake and disc brake models respectively. The bike comes with an advanced and refined 3-valve Ecothrust engine. The other features of the bike include telescopic oil damped front suspension, 5-step adjustable hydraulic series spring suspension at the rear, the longest and the widest seats, and 60-watt headlight.
title: TVS Victor relaunched
